tagDescription: C.M. Conrad, Secretary of War, to J.J. Smith and Wm. B. Draper - Terms upon which Governors Island, New York, may be used for the Industrial Exhibition planned for 1852.
Thompson & Forman: Contract for sale and delivery of 22,000 tons of rails.
Daniel Lord to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing and explanatory letter addressed to Mr. Ward which will prevent any uneasiness as to the Merchants' Exchange Securities.
J.J. Chaviteau to Baring Bros. & Co. An interesting description of San Francisco.
Geo. Griswold to Hon. T. Baring M.P. Covering several documents relating to the Illinois Central Railroad.
Correspondence relative to the British Sugar Refining Co. Also Schroder's Patent Open Disc Pan.
J.E. Armstrong: Ohio stock.
Thomas Smith: Refers to the Pennsylvania Railway.
John Abel Smith to T. Baring M.P. Relative to possible action on his part while in America with regard to the re-establishment of the credit of Illinois.
Thomas Swann, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Delivery of rails.
F.H. Elsmore, Withdrawal of the Bank as security for bonds. Procedure to safeguard Barings' interests.
Benjamin Rich: Encloses duplicate of letters of 26 February 1848, 27 January 1848, 18 March 1850 re Settlement of account.
Dexter & Abbot to T.W. Ward covering Merchants' & Planters' Price Current.
H. Gray, Jr.: Sugar trade.
Victualling Office for the Royal Navy, Admiralty, London: Purchase of American Salt Beef.
Lee, Higginson & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Concerning the affairs of the Lowell Railroad Co.
Jno.Jay Smith & Wm.B.Draper to Baring Bros. & Co. Re contemplated Industrial Exposition to be held on Governor's Island in 1852 - modelled upon the London one.
Edward Belknap to J. Bates - Re construction of an Interoceanic Canal across the Isthmus of Darien by the Atrato Route. (See also 13 March 1852).
J.M. Forbes: Refers to specification for shipbuilding.
Duncan, Sherman & Co.: Opening of account for banking and exchange business.
Farmer & Rogers: Prices and specifications for English steel.
Wm. Sturgis: George B. Blake plans to establish a banking firm in Boston.
Wm. Smith Cruft: Business with Russia.
J.M. Forbes: Trade with China, California. Manner of remittance. Gold.
J. Davis: Shipment of apples.
J. Horsley Palmer to Baring Young - explanatory of his business relations with T. Wilson & Co. and subsequent litigation with D. Leavitt.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton.
P. Perit: Building ship for a Russian Co.; sugar trade, California gold rush.
C.H. Fisher: Introducing Col. John J. McCahen in connection with Pennsylvania's 5% Loan of 5,000,000.
Erastus Corning: Introducing John F. Winslow, Steel Manufacturer.
James K. Mills: Letter of reference for George B. Blake.
Thos. Smith to Baring Bros. & Co. Concerning Bonds of the Pennsylvania Railroad.
D.A. Neal: Encloses statement of the Statistics of the Michigan Central Railroad for 1849-1851.
Jacob Little to J. Bates - Relative to the sale of the Merchants' Exchange Building.

Alfred Penn, Union Bank, to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to the renewal of the Charter of the Union Bank of Louisiana, detailing some alterations which the Stockholders wish to have made in the provisions.
Thomas Swann, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Sale of State bonds.
C.L. Boalt: Shipments of rails. Laying of tracks between Toledo and Cleveland.
Thomas Swann, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Sale of Maryland Sterling bonds to Brown Brothers & Co.
James T. Soutter to Mr. Sturgis - Covering a letter to Baring Bros. & Co. with a plan for the purchase by them of Virginia bonds.
Geo. Baty Blake to J. Bates. Informs him that Mr. Geo. Cabot is retiring from their firm and they propose to continue under the name Blake, Howe & Co.
C.H. Fisher to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to the affairs of the Pennsylvania Railroad Co.
Reverdy Johnson to Baring Bros. & Co. Introducing Mr. Thomas H. Jenkins of Panama.
Wm. Gray: Market value of Massachusetts State Stocks and Boston City Stock.
Gilmore, Blake & Ward: Transaction in securities, City of Boston and State of Massachusetts bonds.
Henry A. Stone: Consignment business.
James Price: Cotton and grain prospects.
Arch. Gracie: Good prospects for cotton crop.
Account "X" for 10,000 pounds with list of firms and amount of credit.
Daniel Lord to T.W. Ward: Refers to laws relating to railroads.
James Robb & John Slidell, Commissioners, to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to the issue of sterling bonds for the New Orleans, Jackson and Great Northern Railroad Co.
Thomas Swann, President Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co., to Baring Bros. & Co. Re Bonds of the Company.
J.M. Forbes to J. Bates - Details of a proposed speculation in whale oil - See letter of Wm. Appleton of even date.
John F. Winslow: Reference to the Bellefontaine & Indiana railroad in relation to the Cleveland, Columbus and Cincinnati Railroad Company.
T.W. Ward to Messrs. Grinnell, Minturn & Co.: China trade. Also copies of letter of 26 April 1849&27 April 1849.
C.L. Boalt to S.G. Ward: Exchange of bonds.
D.A. Neal: Illinois & Michigan Canal and the Illinois Central Railroad compared.
Davis, Brooks & Co.: Expects end of easy money and resulting business failures.
Fullerton & Raymond: Refers to Weardale Iron.
F.H. Elmore, President Bank South Carolina, to Baring Bros. & Co. Re affairs of the Bank.
C.H. Fisher: Refers to the Pennsylvania Railroad.
Thomas Swann to Baring Bros. & Co. Baltimore and Ohio Railroad affairs. Also copy of letter from T.W. Ward of 12 November 1849 with cost of iron.
Thomas Swann, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Maryland Sterling bonds.
A. Lanfear & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Re New Orleans, Opelousas and Great Western Railroad Bonds.
J.B. Neitly: Fear of rebellions among the Irish refugees in Australia and elsewhere.
Sam. J. Randall: Refers to the proposed loan to the City of Philadelphia.
E.J. Forstall to T.W. Ward - re value of the New Orleans property.
Macondary & Co.: Describes conditions; scarcity of money, high prices, speculation in Real Estate.
C.H. Fisher to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to the clandestine visit of Mr. Thomson, President, Pennsylvania Railroad Co. to England.
Importations into London of British and Foreign Grain from 1 January to 31 December 1848 and 1849.
Edm. DePestre: Agency for Santa Maria Estate, Cuba.
C.H. Fisher: Reports sales and demand for securities.
Memo. on the manufacture of sugar from Beet Root. communicated by Mr. Erickson.
E.A. Freret, Union Bank of Louisiana: Remittances on account.
S. Heeper to Russell Sturgis - makes proposition re Eastern Railroad Loan. N.B. Mr. Sturgis' reply is filed with this.
E.M. Davis: Refers to refusal of credit by T.W. Ward.
P. Perit: Formed Partnership with Messrs. W. & G.
H.B. Mildmay to Thos. Baring M.P. Describes his trip to New Orleans, Mexico &c.
Daniel Webster, Department of State, to Edward Belknap: Land grant from the Republic of New Granada for the construction of canal. Protection of the project under the Treaty of 19 April 1850.

Samuel A. Eliot, to Hon. Thos. Baring - Introducing Prof. Mitchel of Cincinnati, distinguished for his inventions and discoveries in Astronomy. N.B. - S.A. Eliot was the father of the President of Harvard, C.W. Eliot.
J.M. Forbes to J. Bates - Michigan Central Railroad and its chances of success.
Jacob Little to J. Bates. Enclosing newspaper article on the subject of the New York State Loan.
C.A. Davis: New administration; patronage. Political news; business matters.
B.T. Reed: Towlaw Iron Works.
Francis P. Corbin: Transaction in securities.
Geo. Griswold: Conditions for negotiating a loan of up to 5 millions.
M.H. Grinnell: Hudson River Railroad Company.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton.
Wm. Crawshay: Rails.
Alex Jones, Telegraph Reporter and Agent for the New York, Philadelphia and Boston Press to J. Bates - re his methods of transmission of news &c.
James Bayley & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing letter from Edm. DePostro relative to Santa Maria Estate, Cuba. (See 13 September 1850).
Fred Frey: Bank invests in drafts with bills of lading.
Abbott Lawrence to J. Bates - re satisfactory financial condition of Boston City.
Geo .W. Billings to T. Baring M.P. Re claim of Messrs. Hope & Co. against the State of Mississippi &c.
D.A. Neal: Illinois Central Railroad Company.
P. Perit: California Gold. Panama Railroad.
Assay Office: Negative result of test for gold on quartz sample.
Benjamin Rich: Settlement of account; personal.
Blake, Ward & Co.: Boston City Stocks and other securities. Shipment of gold.
City of Boston - Papers received from W. Thomas - His authority - Webster's opinion - Solicitor's opinion - Amount of Debt &c.
Hanan & Co., New Orleans to Baring Bros. & Co. Re offer to purchase three stores in New Orleans belonging to them.
New Mexico Silver-Lead Mine, Prussia - Memo re resources of.
Geo. W. Billings to Baring Bros. & Co. Concerning prospects of the State of Illinois as to payment of interest on her debt.
Fox, Henderson & Co., Great Exhibition, Hyde Park: Exposition Building, Governors Island, New York.
R.W. Weston: Commodities market; sugar, coffee and cotton.
Blake, Ward & Co.: Exchange and banking business.
M. Thayer to J. Bates - re New York Loan - enclosing list of the offers and the parties who obtained the loan.
A. Gracie to Baring Bros. & Co. Covering Commercial Circular - New Orleans wholesale prices.
Statistics of the Manufacturing Companies of the United States.
Thomas Swann, President Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co., to Baring Bros. & Co. Affairs of the Company.
A.F. Insinger: Plan to raise 12,500,000 pounds to industrialize Australia. American securities. Personal.
Thompson & Foreman: Inspection of rails.
Adams & Dixon, Jackson, Mississippi: Refers to decision of Superior Court of Chancery on the Mississippi Union Bank bonds.
W.B. Ogden to T. Baring, Esq. Enclosing suggestion for improving the condition of the State of Illinois & her creditors by better provisions for the payment of her debt.
J. Conrie to Capt. C.E. Mangles. Re Panama Railroad shares.
Memo - The Mobile and Ohio Railroad Company . Sgd/ T. Emanuel.
J.R. Ingersoll: Personal.
Thompson and Foreman: Delivery of rails.
J.L. White, H.L. Routh to Baring Bros. & Co. Re affairs of American Atlantic & Pacific Ship Canal Co.

A.G. Benson, James C. Jewett, to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing letter from Secretary of State of the United States, giving protection to their ships engaged in procuring cargoes of Guano from the Lobes Islands - List of chartered vessels &c.
Wm. S. Warwick: Cotton operations.
Blake, Ward & Co. - Mr. Wm. Thomas' mission re Boston City Stock.
M. Escandon to Baring Bros. & Co. Proposing operations in Cotton in Mexico, in partnership with Mr. Barron and himself.
J.M. Forbes: Request for credit for the firm of Macondray & Co. of San Francisco.
C.L. Perkins: Purchase of rails.
W.H. Swift to T.W. Ward. Concerning the Illinois and Michigan Canal.
Wm. Beech: Sugar crop.
Charles L. Perkins: Order for rails for the Milwaukee and Mississippi Railroad Co.
Gabriel Shaw: Declines to do business in American stocks but would market securities current in the Stock Exchange.
Henry W. Gair: Situation in Cuba; revolution, yellow fever, cholera. Will sail for Havana.
Daniel Lord to Baring Bros. & Co. Re sale of Merchants' Exchange Bonds.
Jacob Little: Would like to renew exchange business.
Copies of correspondence from Elisha Copeland, Benjamin Seaver, Mayor, City of Boston and Blake, Ward & Co.: City of Boston Water Loan.
Daniel Lord: Judgment in the case of the Merchant Exchange.
E.A. Freret, Union Bank of Louisiana: The Government of the United States issued $5,000,000 of bonds to the State of Texas.
C.L. Boalt to Baring Bros. & Co. Affairs of the Cleveland and Toledo Railroad Company.
E.A. Freret, Union Bank of Louisiana: Press copy referring to the bank affairs.
R.D. Shepherd to T.W. Ward: Difficulties in selling property in New Orleans.
Wm. Harriman & Co.: Request for renewal of credit.
Geo. B. Upton, Michigan Central Railroad: Wants rails delivered at Montreal. Discusses economy of Michigan.
Grant & Stone to Baring Bros. & Co. Re probability of Pennsylvania Central Railroad Co. requiring a loan of $2,000,000.
J. Hersley Palmer to James Mackillop - Re representation of certain Illinois Canal bondholders of matters relating to the Canal Trust, forwarded by him.
Mississippi Debt.
Blake, Ward & Co.: Offer of $180,000 of Boston City Stock.
Homfray to Messrs. Thompson and Foreman: Relative to faulty rails.
A. Vail: Introducing John F. Winslow.
Thomas Swann, President Baltimore & Ohio Railroad, to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to the affairs of the Company.
R.W. Weston: Market for tea, coffee, cotton and sugar.
Philip Pusey to T. Baring, M.P. Introducing Mr. MacCormick the inventor of the Reaping Machine.
Henry S. Garrett, (of Baltimore); Indicates possible negotiations for bonds.
J. Davis: Business reference for George B. Blake.
E.C. Baring: Discusses economy of Mexico, California gold rush and Panama railway.
J.M. Forbes: Refers to two ships put in service and extolls their usefullness.
J. Woodfield: Extract of letter referring to new discovery of quicksilver.
Myers & Co. to J. Bates - Relative to a plan for disposal of Virginia Western Lands to Emigrants.
Wm. Gray: Massachusetts state bonds.
E.A. Freret, Union Bank of Louisiana: Remittances and exchange business.
Thomas Swann, President Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Co., to Baring Bros. & Co. Increasing demands for power require a second track to be laid between Baltimore and the Coal fields.
D.A. Neal: Illinois Central Railroad bonds.
J.M. Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co. With regard to the alteration in the Navigation Laws.
R.J. Nelson, Capt. R. Eng., to Baring Bros. & Co.: Condemning the Nicaragua Canal project.
J.M. Forbes: Explains failure of R.B. Forbes.
Russell Sturgis to Sam Hooper: Eastern Railroad.
Wm. Sturgis: Character reference for Addison Gilmore.
F.L. Brauns & Co.: Credit for tobacco purchases.
R.B. Forbes: Refers to Messrs. Russell & Co.
P. Perit: Interview with Benjamin DeForest.
Benjamin Rich: Asks to settle account.
Fred Frey, Union Bank of Louisiana: Payment on bonds
George B. Blake: Exchange and banking business.
R.D. Shepherd to T.W. Ward: Will continue to take care of Barings business.
Plan for arrangement of the Debt of the State of Mississippi.
Geo. Griswold: Introducing Capt. J.G.Smith, ship Richard Alsop, in connection with the ship Challenge.
J.C.R. Davis: Mississippi Union Bank bonds. New York and Erie Railroad Company.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton.
Geo. Peabody & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Accepting their offer of 20,000 pounds City of Boston bonds.
Davis, Brooks & Co.: Shipment of rails.
Thomas Swann, President Baltimore & Ohio Railroad to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to the affairs of the Company.
P.T. Barnum of J. Bates - Enclosing stock to be held in trust, subject to the order of Jenny Lind at any moment after he may have forfeited his agreement with her.
James C. Dunn, City Treasurer, to Messrs. Blake, Ward & Co.: $500,000 of Water Loan.
Fullerton & Raymond: Pressure for tariff on imported steel. President Fillmore favours protection for domestic steel industry.
M. King: Bill of Messrs. Ravenel Brothers & Co. on David Lamb.

H.B. Mildmay (Washington) to T. Baring M.P. Reporting results of his visit to the United States - affairs of the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad - political news - payment of the Mexican Indemnity - S. O'Brien's release - Crampton's appointment &c.
Panama Railway Co. - Shares of Baring Bros. & Co., Frederick Huth & Co. and Cavan Bros. & Co.
George B. Blake: Exchange and credit operations.
Arch. Gracie to J. Bates covering Circular - New Orleans Price - Current, Commercial Intelligencer and Merchants' Transcript.
Specie in Banks of City of New York from 1842 to 1852.
Henry Lee Jr.: Request for credit and exchange business. Also memo of reply of 21 February 1853.
R.W. Trundy: Refers to A.G. Benson in connection with shipping guano.
Thos. Swann, Baltimore & Ohio Railway Co., to T.W. Ward: Bonds.
F.H. Elsmore, Bank of the State of South Carolina, Charleston: Contract with General McDuffie for the Fire Loan Bonds.
Statistics of the Whale Fishery of the United States.
E.S. Wholen & Co.: Partnership with Russell Sturgis.
Gilmore, Blake & Ward: Securities market. Transactions with George Peabody.
Elihu Burritt to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing tract on Ocean Penny Postage. N.B. An interesting Envelope is attached to the letter (without the stamp.)
Wm. Appleton & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Introducing Mr. Richard P. Dana.
Slave population of the United States, viewed in reference to the question of the capacity of the country to produce cotton. Sgd/ H.B. Gwathney.
Wm. Smith Cruft: Speculates on price structure of cotton in view of a crop of 2,300,000 bales.
Grant & Stone: Introducing Richard Norris in connection with the case of Arustein & Esckles vs. Wm. Norris. Also a visit to English industrial works.
David Leavitt to T.W. Ward: Refers to laws regulating payments.
Ogden & Jones, Chicago to Capt. W.H. Swift: Investment in canal property.
J.C. Burnham & Co.: Sugar and cotton crops; Santa Maria Estate.
J.M. Forbes: Shipbuilding.
Sam Sanford: Introduction for Messrs. Foster and Taylor, wine merchants.
Statistics of the Banks of Massachusetts. Sgd./S.G.W.

Thomas Olive to T. Baring Esq. With regard to 508 shares in the United States Bank which in 1835 cost his uncle, Mr. Thomas Charters, 13,000 pounds, which he wishes to have presented at the meeting of the Trustees of that Bank in Philadelphia on the 4th October.
Blake, Ward & Co.: Exchange and discount business.
Blake, Ward & Co.: Advises against dealing with Gilbert, Cobb and Johnson in connection with the City of Boston Bonds.
J. Mackillop to David Leavitt: Reference to the case of Blatchford & Murray Trust. Also reply of same date.
Girard Stites to Baring Bros. & Co. Railway situation in Mississippi and other Southern States - and a suggestion re absorption of Planters Bank Bonds.
F.H. Elsmore, Bank of the State of South Carolina, Charleston: Fire Loan Bonds.
Thomas Swann, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Sale of Sterling bonds.
Geo. Griswold to Baring Bros. & Co. affairs of Illinois Central Railroad Co.
Grant & Stone to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing report of the proceedings of a meeting of Stockholders of the United States Bank.
H. Schaeffer: Prefers to stay in Boston or New York. Personal matters.
Elliott Cresson to J. Bates. Concerning the Sunbury and Erie Railroad.
Stephen Fairbanks, Weston Railroad: References for George B. Blake and Addison Gilmore.
Blake, Ward & Co.: Arrangement for remitting payment. Investment in safe securities.
Thomas Swann, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Refers to purchase of portion of company's bonds.
Calculation of price of 6% Baltimore & Ohio Railroad bonds at a rate that will give 5%.
Geo. B. Blake: Credit account, discount on bills and other securities' transactions.
J.L. Clarke: Refers to contracts for rails for the Utica and Schenectady Railway Co.
John R. Reid to Mildmay: State of their gold in Paris.
Grant & Stone to Baring Bros. & Co. Re loan for Tennessee.
Gilmore, Blake and Ward: Credit for exchange business.
Winslow, Lanier & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Re Bonds of the Boston and Worcester Railroad Corporation.
Harleston Parker: Request for letter of credit for 300 pounds.
Thomas Swann, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Introduction for Wm. Parker, General Superintendent.
Horace Gray, Jr.: Sale of sugar in London.
Daniel Lord: Refers to the Merchant Exchange lawsuit.
E. Stainer to Baring Bros. & Co. Submitting Mr. Michiel's Pamphlet on his Patented Invention for the Production of Sugar from its cane.
J.M. Forbes: Introducing John F. Winslow, Steel Manufacturer. New type of rails.
Blake, Herne (?) & Co.: Exchange and banking.
Blake, Ward & Co.: Refer to objections of Barings to invest money in the United States.
Gilmore, Blake and Ward: Securities and exchange business.
Wm. Gray: Securities' transactions. Atlantic cotton mills.
Unsigned: Statements showing value of imports and exports in general, and exports of cotton, and imports of tea and coffee for the years 1851 and 1852.
Blake, Ward & Co.: Exchange and discount business.
Eu. A. Freret, Union Bank Louisiana, to Baring Bros. & Co. Re the standing of houses in England, enclosing press copies of 1848 lists of London, Liverpool, Manchester &c. houses.
Total exports in 1847 from United States of America to all countries and total exports from United Kingdom to the United States of America from 1827-1851, to which is added the rate per cent.
Thompson Lapham & Co.: Refers to Transey Crown Iron. Also gives specifications and lists customers.
Sam. T. Dana: Refers to his brother's proposed venture in China.
Unsigned memo on bonded securities.
C.H. Fisher: Sales of bonds of the Pennsylvania Railroad Company.
Arch. Gracie: Request to draw against consignments of cotton.
Joshua Bates to T. Baring, M.P. Relative to the Nicaragua Canal project.
Sam Hooper to Russell Sturgis, London: Eastern Railroad Co.
Blake, Ward & Co.: City of Boston bonds.
Jacob Little to J. Bates - Relative to the affairs to The Merchants' Exchange.
Arch. Gracie: Request to draw on London of New York firms.
P. Cadell Jr., to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to his having established himself as agent for the Investment of Capital in the Dividend Paying Gold Mines of California &c.
Chas. Stokes to [T. Baring, M.P.] Relative to the affairs of the Mississippi bondholders.
Thomas Swann, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Maryland Sterling bonds.
Chas. Stokes: Refers to the Mississippi bondholders
Unsigned assay of gold ore for Mr. Comstock, San Francisco.
Davis, Brooks & Co.: Railroad over the Isthmus of Panama.
Blake, Ward & Co.: Credit, discount and exchange business.
Sam. Sanford: Asks for loan on Real Estate in Boston.
Wm. Beech: Sale of sugar in Copenhagen.
Unsigned, Bank of the State of South Carolina, Charleston: Refusal to recharter the Bank of the State.
Baring Bros. to Thos. Swann: Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Co. (Press copy).

James A. Forbes, British Vice-Consul for California, to Eustace W. Barron, H.M. Consul, Topic. Reporting the state of the country - more particularly in relation to the auriferous deposits on the tributary streams of the Sacramento and Sto. Joachim Rivers.
P. Perit: Russian order for a ship. Asks for opinion on Manning and McIntosh to Mexico.
Joshua Bates to Mr. Young - Relative to the question of Guano from the Lobos Islands.
Thompson Lapham & Co.: Removal of defects from the Weardale Iron.
Lambert Dexter to Joshua Bates - re Loan for Northern Railroad Company, New York. Also letter of 17 April 1850 and list of shareholders.
Wm. Appleton: Speculation in whale oil.
S.V. Monich to C.H. Fisher: Right of Pennsylvania Railroad to subscribe to the Marietta Railroad's stock.
Blake, Ward & Co.: Exchange operations.
Fred Frey, Union Bank of Louisiana: Redemption of D. Bonds at par.
Arch. Gracie to T.W. Ward: Cotton.
C.A. Davis to J. Bates - The State of the country financially, politically &c.
C. VanDerbilt and J.L. White to Baring Bros. & Co. Interesting information about the Nicaragua Ship Canal.
Blake, Ward & Co.: Reorganization of the firm because of death of Addison Gilmore and entry of James M. Howe.

Davis, Brooks & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Enquires re Rails for the Railroad across the Isthmus of Panama, which only awaits the passage of a Law by Congress to enable the projectors to proceed with the undertaking - Specifications follow.
Fullerton & Raymond: Introducing Sam. M. Raymond in connection with the Weardale Pig Iron.
Adot, Spalding & Co: Gray's sugar estate of Arroyo.
D.A. Neal to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to the prospects of the projected Illinois Central Railroad.
Eu. A. Freret to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to closing out the old Bank of Louisiana and inaugurating the new.
Wm. Thomas, Agent for the Finance Committee of Boston City, to Baring Bros. & Co. Re Loan of 200,000 pounds for the City of Boston.
Wm. Rees to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to a scheme for California Railroad.
H.B. Mildmay to Thomas Baring - Describes a shipwreck on his voyage between St. Louis and New Orleans.
Watts Sherman to Joshua Bates - re Hudson River Railroad.
Watts Sherman: Gives list of places cashing letters of credit.
Girard Stites: Legislature provided no compensation for bondholders of the Planters Bank.
Russell Sturgis to Sam Hooper: Eastern Railroad.
G. Bailey Toms: Refers to faulty rails.
Watts Sherman to J. Bates - Comments upon England's policy of free trade - American Stock - California gold rush.
J.B. Greene to J. Bates. Concerning the proposed establishment of Line of Steamers to run between New York and Havre &c.
P. Perit: Introducing Richard P. Dana.
Newspaper Extract: Complete list of vessels which sailed from ports in the United States for California since the gold rush.
Thomas Swann, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Sale of State bonds.
Certificate relating to Messrs. A.& E. Mornay's Patent Sugar Mill. Sgd./ H.Augustus Cowper, H.M.Consul, Pernambuco.
T. DeMarcoleta, Nicaraguan Minister: Financial arrangements with Rostchild (Rothschild). Also newspaper clipping about the Nicaragua canal venture.
Blake, Ward & Co.: Exchange and credit business.
T. DeMarcoleta, Minister of Nicaragua: Refers to the firm of Rostchild (Rothschild), the Panama railway and the Nicaragua canal venture.
E.J.H. & S. Lawford to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad mortgage.
D. Leavitt to Baring Bros. & Co. Re complaints of his proceedings as Receiver of the North American Trust & Banking Company.
F.L. Brauns & Co., to Baring Bros. & Co. Re French Contract for Maryland Tobacco.
August Belmont: Extract of letter about introduction for the Nicaragua Minister.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton.
J.H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward - re affairs of the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.
Thomas Swann, President North Western Virginia Railroad Co. (Parkersbury Road), to Baring Bros. & Co. Places the claims of this Road before them and asserts faith in its future success.
Erastus Corning: Credit for 5,000 tons of rails for the Rome and Cape Vincent Railroad.
Russell Sturgis to Sam Hooper: Eastern Railroad Co. Loan.

H.B. Mildmay to J. Bates - Interesting description of Mr. James Wadsworth's estate at or near Geneseo, New York State - Panama Railroad Stock not affected by proposed Ship Canal - Canadian Emigrants for Australia.
Daniel Lord to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to Merchants' Exchange matters.
C.L. Boalt, T.N. & C. Railroad Co.: Railway matters.
W. Amery (?) to Geo. B. Blake: Trial balances.
Petty Vaughan to J. Bates re Estate of W.N. Boylston.
Aaron H. Palmer: Encloses documents from the American and Foreign Agency (missing).
Arch. Gracie: Cotton.
(B.B. & Co.) to Governor French, Illinois - relative to the short payment of the Interest on the State Debt.
Gabriel Shaw: Dwindling earnings from brokerage business.
W.G.C. Mann: Mexican affairs. Santa Anna well received. Mexican stock.
Thompson, Lapham & Co.: Sale of Weardale iron.
Fred Frey, Union Bank of Louisiana: Redemption of State bonds at par.
Grant & Stone: Tennessee loan bonds. Also memo on same subject of 27 September 1850.
Petty Vaughan: Estate of W.N. Boylston.
J.M. Forbes: Shipbuilding.
Thomas Butler, Mount Surprise: Offers services as manager of coal mines and iron works. Also letter to Josiah Larkin of same date.
Wm. Harriman & Co.: Renewal of credit.
E.S. Wholen & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Proposals re Philadelphia City 6 per cent loan.
A. Gracie to Baring Bros & Co. Covering Mobile Journal of Commerce Letter - Sheet - Price-Current.
Thomas Swann, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Power of Attorney to sell 100,000 pounds of Sterling Bonds. Also letter from J.H.B. Latrobe of 15 June 1850.
Thomson Hankey Jr., Bank of England, to T. Baring M.P. Re their buying American Eagles at 76/3 per oz.
Daniel Webster, Department of State to James C. Jewett, Bargue Philomea: Rights to exploit guano from the Lobos Islands (near the coast of Peru) by citizens of other countries.
C.L. Boalt: Refers to the Michigan Southern and Northern Indiana Railroad; Wabash Valley Road. Shipping line between Cleveland and Buffalo.
Fullerton & Raymond: Sale of Weardale pig iron.
Comparative Statement of the Receipts from Customs during the Fiscal years ending 30 June 1850 and 1851 per returns received to 3 April in each year, exclusive of California and Oregon.
